div.ab: The most honorable Theodoros, son of Obodianos, has given [on account of his taxes for a vineyard called] al-Abla alias Mal Ouda, located [in the hamlet Baith el-Alkeb, registered] through Horion, son of Leontios, the [most blessed] grandfather [of Leontios, son of Valens, politeuomenos,] every year one half, one third, one eighth, (and) one sixtieth (iugum?) for iugerum [from] ... to the second indiction, ten (or -teen) years [all the exacted and extra] (taxes) in farm products and in oinokreon [and in ? products according] to the imperial delegatio. (I,) Flavius Leontios, son of Valens, [the aforementioned, have received as stated. Written] in month Peritios of the year 430-four (=434), [third] indiction...
